result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Warrant/capias/commitment entered into all three systems and forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $1000 sig bond; missed hrg 8-16-22 and 10-18-22
Deft also failed to appear on 8-16-22.

9:15 AM Defendant Robyn L Seamandel not in court.  Attorney Cristina Raquel Mondragon in court for Robyn L Seamandel.  Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matters were scheduled for change of plea.
Warrant was stayed until today.
Deft missed court back on 8-16-22.
Defense indicates the deft was stranded in Fond Du Lac.
State is requesting a warrant.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 48 hrs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robyn L Seamandel not in court.  Attorney Cristina Raquel Mondragon in court for Robyn L Seamandel. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matters were scheduled for change of plea.
Defense indicates the deft is at training for work.
State would ask for a BW.
BTC: New date set, matters adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

2:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robyn L Seamandel in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
